abstract: Gaza City Journal; Mohammed Musa Taqatqa and many of his fellow former Palestinian prisoners, who were freed in exchange for the release of Israeli Sgt First Class Gilad Shalit, are living in the full glare of near constant publicity; transition and unceasing attention have made Taqatqa a bit uneasy as he tries to learn to deal not only with freedom but also with many of the trappings of modern life.
snippet: Mohammed Musa Taqatqa, among the first batch of Palestinian prisoners freed in return for an Israeli tank soldier, is trying to adjust to his new life.
lead_paragraph: Mohammed Musa Taqatqa, among the first batch of Palestinian prisoners freed in return for an Israeli tank soldier, is trying to adjust to his new life.

headline.main: Making the Uneasy Transition From Prisoner to Celebrity
headline.print_headline: Making the Uneasy Transition From Prisoner to Celebrity
headline.seo: Freed Palestinian Prisoners Adjust to Life as Celebrities
